DOMAIN_SEPARATOR().details: Off-chain signers should use this to construct valid EIP-712 signatures.

acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

anchorV4((uint48,address,bytes),(uint48,.details: Core function that processes blocks sequentially within a proposal:      1. Designates prover when a new proposal starts (i.e. the first block of a proposal)      2. Anchors L1 block data for cross-chain verification

params._checkpoint: Checkpoint data for the L1 block being anchored.
params._proposalParams: Proposal-level parameters that define the overall batch.

params._bondManager: The address of the bond manager.
params._checkpointStore: The address of the checkpoint store.
params._livenessBond: The liveness bond amount in Wei.

decodeProverAuth(bytes).details: Decodes `ProverAuth` calldata; kept public so `validateProverAuth` can try/catch via `this.decodeProverAuth` to avoid reverting on malformed encodings.

params._currentDesignatedProver: The current designated prover from state.

returns.isLowBondProposal_: True if proposer has insufficient bonds.
returns.provingFeeToTransfer_: The proving fee (Wei) to transfer from the proposer to the designated prover.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

validateProverAuth(uint48,address,bytes).details: Validates prover authentication and extracts signer.

params._proposalId: The proposal ID to validate against.
params._proposer: The proposer address to validate against.

returns.provingFee_: The proving fee in Wei (0 if validation fails).
returns.signer_: The recovered signer address (proposer if validation fails).

params._token: Token address or address(0) if Ether.

ANCHOR_GAS_LIMIT().notice: Gas limit for anchor transactions (must be enforced).

DOMAIN_SEPARATOR().notice: Returns the EIP-712 domain separator for prover authorization signatures.

GOLDEN_TOUCH_ADDRESS().notice: Golden touch address is the only address that can do the anchor transaction.

anchorV4((uint48,address,bytes),(uint48,.notice: Processes a block within a proposal and anchors L1 data.

blockHashes(uint256).notice: Mapping from block number to block hash.

bondManager().notice: Contract managing bond deposits, withdrawals, and transfers.

checkpointStore().notice: Checkpoint store for storing L1 block data.

getBlockState().notice: Returns the current block-level state snapshot.

getDesignatedProver(uint48,address,bytes.notice: Returns the designated prover for a proposal.

getProposalState().notice: Returns the current proposal-level state snapshot.

init(address).notice: Initializes the owner of the Anchor.

livenessBond().notice: Bond amount in Wei for liveness guarantees.

paused().notice: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

resolver().notice: Returns the address of this contract.

withdraw(address,address).notice: Withdraw token or Ether from this address. Note: This contract receives a portion of L2 base fees, while the remainder is directed to L2 block's coinbase address.

documentation.text:
@notice Authentication data for prover designation.
 @dev Used to allow a proposer to designate another address as the prover.
@notice Proposal-level data that applies to the entire batch of blocks.
@notice Stored proposal-level state for the ongoing batch.

@notice Stored block-level state for the latest anchor.
 @dev 2 slots
@notice Golden touch address is the only address that can do the anchor transaction.
@notice Gas limit for anchor transactions (must be enforced).
@dev Length of a standard ECDSA signature (r: 32 bytes, s: 32 bytes, v: 1 byte).
@dev EIP-712 domain/type hashes for prover authorization signatures.
@notice Contract managing bond deposits, withdrawals, and transfers.
@notice Checkpoint store for storing L1 block data.
@notice Bond amount in Wei for liveness guarantees.
@notice The L1's chain ID.
@notice Mapping from block number to block hash.

@dev Slots used by the Pacaya anchor contract itself.
 slot1: publicInputHash
 slot2: parentGasExcess, lastSyncedBlock, parentTimestamp, parentGasTarget
 slot3: l1ChainId
@notice Latest proposal-level state, updated only on the first block of a proposal.
@notice Latest block-level state, updated on every processed block.
@notice Storage gap for upgrade safety.

@notice Initializes the owner of the Anchor.
 @param _owner The owner of this contract
@notice Returns the current proposal-level state snapshot.
@notice Returns the current block-level state snapshot.

@dev Decodes `ProverAuth` calldata; kept public so `validateProverAuth` can try/catch via
 `this.decodeProverAuth` to avoid reverting on malformed encodings.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes memory) pure external returns (struct Anchor.ProverAuth memory)

documentation.text:
@dev Validates and processes proposal-level data on the first block.
 @param _proposalParams Proposal-level parameters containing all proposal data.

@dev Validates and processes block-level data.
 @param _checkpoint Anchor checkpoint data from L1.
@dev Checks whether a decoded `ProverAuth` payload targets the expected proposal context.

@dev Hashes a `ProverAuth` payload into the message that must be signed by the prover.
 @dev Uses EIP-712 structured data hashing for better security and wallet compatibility.
@dev Returns the EIP-712 struct hash for a `ProverAuth` payload.

@dev Builds the EIP-712 domain separator for prover authorization signatures.
 @dev Uses standard EIP-712 fields: name, version, chainId, and verifyingContract.
